fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-25280].
  {panel}

Currently, on Confluence 4.2, you can only configure the page layout through the UI, by clicking on the layout icon 

This can be following this documentation:
* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Working+with+page+layouts+and+columns+and+sections

It would be nice to have a seperate Wiki Markup for page layout.
fields.summary: Wiki Markup for Page Layout

fields.description:
Safari on OSX requires the use of control instead of command for most keyboard shortcuts, Chrome for some.

The help screen (attached) shows using control for them all, which is correct for Chrome & Firefox but should be changed if opened in Safari.

The same is true of a lot of the tooltips.
fields.summary: Some Keyboard Shortcut Screen & Tooltips on Mac incorrect for Safari & Chorme

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-25278].
  {panel}

h5. Steps to reproduce:
# Add the following CSS in your Space PDF Stylesheet:
{code}
@page 
{
    margin: 5.5in;
}
{code}
# Export a Page to PDF and will ended up at System Error page with the following stacktrace:
{code}
2012-04-19 17:22:06,698 ERROR [http-8080-3] [[Standalone].[localhost].[/confluence].[action]] log Servlet.service() for servlet action threw exception
java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
    at java.util.LinkedList.addBefore(LinkedList.java:778)
    at java.util.LinkedList.add(LinkedList.java:198)
    at org.xhtmlrenderer.css.newmatch.CascadedStyle.addProperties(CascadedStyle.java:148)
    at org.xhtmlrenderer.css.newmatch.CascadedStyle.<init>(CascadedStyle.java:135)
    at org.xhtmlrenderer.css.newmatch.Matcher.getPageCascadedStyle(Matcher.java:121)
    at org.xhtmlrenderer.context.StyleReference.getPageStyle(StyleReference.java:203)
    at org.xhtmlrenderer.layout.Layer.createPageBox(Layer.java:794)
    at org.xhtmlrenderer.layout.Layer.addPage(Layer.java:764)
    at org.xhtmlrenderer.layout.Layer.addPagesUntilPosition(Layer.java:875)
    at org.xhtmlrenderer.layout.Layer.getPage(Layer.java:861)
    at org.xhtmlrenderer.layout.Layer.getFirstPage(Layer.java:805)
    at org.xhtmlrenderer.render.BlockBox.layout(BlockBox.java:774)
    at org.xhtmlrenderer.render.BlockBox.layout(BlockBox.java:735)
    at org.xhtmlrenderer.pdf.ITextRenderer.layout(ITextRenderer.java:209)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.flyingpdf.FlyingSaucerXmlToPdfConverter.convertXhtmlToPdf(FlyingSaucerXmlToPdfConverter.java:92)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.flyingpdf.FlyingSaucerXmlToPdfConverter.convertXhtmlToPdf(FlyingSaucerXmlToPdfConverter.java:38)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.flyingpdf.FlyingSaucerPdfExporterService.createPdfForPage(FlyingSaucerPdfExporterService.java:78)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.flyingpdf.ExportPageAsPdfAction.execute(ExportPageAsPdfAction.java:28)
    at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionInvocation.invoke(DefaultActionInvocation.java:168)
    at com.opensymphony.xwork.interceptor.AroundInterceptor.intercept(AroundInterceptor.java:35)
    at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionInvocation.invoke(DefaultActionInvocation.java:165)
    at com.opensymphony.xwork.interceptor.DefaultWorkflowInterceptor.intercept(DefaultWorkflowInterceptor.java:55)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.core.ConfluenceWorkflowInterceptor.intercept(ConfluenceWorkflowInterceptor.java:37)
    at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionInvocation.invoke(DefaultActionInvocation.java:165)
    at com.opensymphony.xwork.interceptor.AroundInterceptor.intercept(AroundInterceptor.java:35)
    at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionInvocation.invoke(DefaultActionInvocation.java:165)
    at com.atlassian.xwork.interceptors.XsrfTokenInterceptor.intercept(XsrfTokenInterceptor.java:100)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.xwork.ConfluenceXsrfTokenInterceptor.intercept(ConfluenceXsrfTokenInterceptor.java:25)
    at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionInvocation.invoke(DefaultActionInvocation.java:165)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.security.interceptors.CaptchaInterceptor.intercept(CaptchaInterceptor.java:49)
    at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionInvocation.invoke(DefaultActionInvocation.java:165)
    at com.opensymphony.xwork.interceptor.AroundInterceptor.intercept(AroundInterceptor.java:35) 
{code}
# Export the Space to PDF and it will take forever and throw the following in the stacktrace:
{code}
2012-04-19 17:02:40,878 ERROR [Long running task: PDF Space Export] [content.render.xhtml.DefaultRenderer] render Error rendering content for view: RuntimeException occurred while performing an XHTML storage transformation (null)
 -- referer: http://localhost:8080/confluence/spaces/flyingpdf/flyingpdf.action?key=SBX | url: /confluence/spaces/flyingpdf/doflyingpdf.action | userName: admin | action: doflyingpdf
com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.XhtmlException: RuntimeException occurred while performing an XHTML storage transformation (null)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.storage.StorageXhtmlTransformer.transform(StorageXhtmlTransformer.java:60)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.TransformerChain.transform(TransformerChain.java:41)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.PluggableTransformerChain.transform(PluggableTransformerChain.java:53)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.DefaultRenderer.render(DefaultRenderer.java:63)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.DefaultRenderer.render(DefaultRenderer.java:51)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.flyingpdf.html.RenderedXhtmlBuilder.renderToHtml(RenderedXhtmlBuilder.java:377)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.flyingpdf.html.RenderedXhtmlBuilder.renderContentTreeNodes(RenderedXhtmlBuilder.java:346)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.flyingpdf.html.RenderedXhtmlBuilder.buildHtml(RenderedXhtmlBuilder.java:134)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.flyingpdf.FlyingSaucerPdfExporterService.createPdfForSpace(FlyingSaucerPdfExporterService.java:50)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.flyingpdf.PdfExportLongRunningTask$1.doInTransactionWithoutResult(PdfExportLongRunningTask.java:70)
    at org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionCallbackWithoutResult.doInTransaction(TransactionCallbackWithoutResult.java:33)
    at org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionTemplate.execute(TransactionTemplate.java:128)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.flyingpdf.PdfExportLongRunningTask.runInternal(PdfExportLongRunningTask.java:52)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.util.longrunning.ConfluenceAbstractLongRunningTask.run(ConfluenceAbstractLongRunningTask.java:21)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.util.longrunning.ManagedTask.run(ManagedTask.java:35)
    at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:441)
    at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(FutureTask.java:303)
    at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:138)
    at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:886)
    at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:908)
    at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:662)
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
    at com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.editor.macro.DefaultPlaceholderUrlFactory.getUrlForErrorPlaceholder(DefaultPlaceholderUrlFactory.java:73)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.transformers.TransformErrorToHtmlPlaceholder.handle(TransformErrorToHtmlPlaceholder.java:54)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.transformers.DefaultFragmentTransformer.transform(DefaultFragmentTransformer.java:124)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.storage.StorageXhtmlTransformer.transform(StorageXhtmlTransformer.java:43)
    ... 20 more
{code}

h5. Findings
It seems that this can only be reproduced if the value of the margin is bigger than 5in.

h5. Workaround
Follow the instructions from the following KB article:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Exporting+Page+or+Space+to+PDF+Fails+and+Causes+High+Load+or+OutOfMemoryError
fields.summary: Page margin CSS in PDF Stylesheet can OOME and cause high load on Confluence during space export to pdf

fields.description:
h5. Steps to reproduce.

# Create a page and add the following:
{noformat}
{tip}

*Transactions*
|| Sr. || Team || Commitment || Transaction Type || Sub-type || Booking reason || Index || Commitment \\
(lCurr) || comm adj || Initial subscriber \\
contribution (lCurr) || Total Amount \\
(lCurr) || Capital \\
(lCurr) || Out of commitment cost \\
(lCurr) || Ref date/Voucher date ||
| A | xyz | Product 1 / Partnership 1 | Secondary Commitment | Purchase | Standard | 1 | 10'000'000 | 8'500'000 (Purchase Price + unfunded) | 7'000'000 | n.a. | n.a. | n.a. | 15/04/08 |
| B | xyz | Product 1 / Partnership 1 | Call | Purchase price | Standard | 2 | n.a. | n.a. | n.a. | 5'500'000 | 5'500'000 | 0 | 15/04/08 |
| C | xyz | Product 1 / Partnership 1 | Call | Finder's fees | Standard | 3 | n.a. | n.a. | n.a. | 25'000 | 0 | 25'000 | 01/05/08 |
| D | xyz | ZZOthers / Partnership 1 | Secondary Commitment | Purchase | Standard | 1 | \-10'000'000 | \-10'000'000 | -  | \- | n.a. | n.a. | 15/04/08 |
{tip}
{noformat}
# Save the page
# Decreased the size of browser window
# You'll get:
!tip macro.jpg!

Reproduced in IE9 and FF 11. Tested on Confluence 3.4.9 & 4.2.
fields.summary: Tip macro display was cut-off when the browser height and width are not fully maximized

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-25276].
  {panel}

First time sended blog comment with non-english characters appears in wrong encoding (see image). Also, notification emails has same issue.
Input language - cyrillic (russian).

Preview function displays comment in the right encoding.
After the editing of that comment it became work properly.
fields.summary: Wrong encoding in blog comments.

fields.description:
h6. Steps to reproduce
# Type a "("
# Immediately follow the paranthesis (no spaces) with an attempt to autoformat, or use mentions e.g. (@joey)

These will not render

reproduced on Chrome and IE9
fields.summary: Autoformat and certain autocomplete functions do not work when preceded by a parenthesis

fields.description:
h6. Steps to reproduce
# Insert an image on a page
# Specify a different width and hit Enter

The image will not resize until the properties panel is dismissed by clicking elsewhere on the screen or saving.

Issue does not occur in Chrome. Hitting enter will resize the image.
fields.summary: Image width does not resize until property panel is dismissed (IE9)
The Confluence with https is incompatible with Jira

fields.description:
h3.Steps to Reproduce:

* Create an pop mail connection, and wait to see your email, then get the id from the mail.
For example: http://127.0.0.1:808/display/DSP/mail/*753669* 
* Following [this|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF35/Linking+to+Mail] documentation.
* Create a new page and write in the WikiMarkup area [$753669] then save that.
* You'll see that's working fine.
* Upgrade to 4.1.7
* Try to edit that page, which we linked that email.
* You'll see that's noway to save that.

h3.Workaround:

* There's no workaround for that.
fields.summary: Page fails to save if it contains a link to an E-Mail Archive

fields.description:
h3. Description of The Bug

When JIRA user add Confluence Page Gadget from Confluence 4.2 into its dashboard, the page will load fine, but there would be a message at the top of the gadget:

{code}The resource <Server Base URL>/rest/likes/1.0/content/undefined/likes, cannot be found.{code}

!likes.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

Disabling "Confluence Like Plugin" from UPM resolve the issue
fields.summary: Confluence Page Gadget on JIRA will shows "Resource cannot be found" on Confluence 4.2

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-25258].
  {panel}

It takes a lot of annoying handwork to setup and customize Confluence to isolate different target groups within one Confluence instance.

One of the most challenging parts is all the social network features. Currently it's just an all or nothing approach.

But instead of disable all the feature globally, I would like to have an option to limit this features on a group-level, e.g.

* Group our-company can collaborate with customer-A and customer-B
* Group customer-A can only collaborate with our-company
* Group customer-F can collaborate with our-company, customer-A and customer-B

So all the features like
* hovering
* mention
* follow
* etc.

will be limited to specific groups.

This could be a big step towards a real _multi-tenancy Confluence_ ...
fields.summary: Allow to limit social features on a group-level - Confluence first steps towards real multi-tenancy capability ...?

fields.description:
see the last "else" branch of the #typeIcon macro in macros.vm: {code} #macro (typeIcon $type) #if ($type == "attachment") #elseif ($type == "all") #else #end #end {code} there is no object $contentUiManager in the Velocity context. it should be ["$contentUiSupport"|http://docs.atlassian.com/atlassian-confluence/4.2/com/atlassian/confluence/content/ui/ContentUiSupport.html], otherwise the image URL is not rendered and shown as broken image h4. Steps to reproduce # Create a User Macro with the following content: {code}

staticResourceUrlPrefix/images/icons/attachments/generic_16.png

staticResourceUrlPrefix/images/icons/list_pages_16.gif

contentUiManager.getLegacyIconPath($type, 16)

contentUiSupport.getLegacyIconPath($type, 16)

{code} # Use it in the page # It will be displayed like this: !bonfire-screenshot-20120510-233535-823.png! h4. Further finding grep in 4.2 source: {code} halatas@halatas-laptop:~/src/atlassian/conf/tags/confluence-4.2.1-source$ grep contentUiManager -R * | wc -l 1 halatas@halatas-laptop:~/src/atlassian/conf/tags/confluence-4.2.1-source$ grep contentUiSupport -R * | wc -l 17 {code}
fields.summary: Missing images in emails as #typeIcon macro refers to $contentUiManager instead of $contentUiSupport

fields.description:
TEST CASE:
1. As any user create Wiki page.
2. Put some text in it, and choose one of the following options for that text from the drop-down.
3. Click the drop-down again, check the alignment of the description and the mark.

EXPECTED BEHAVIOUR:
Should be displayed normally.

OBSERVED BEHAVIOUR:
The mark and the description for the font options are intersected (screenshots).
fields.summary: SCN > Wiki: The mark and the description for the font options are intersected

fields.description:
A customer has reported that PDF exports do not handle page layouts. See comment on doc page:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Working+with+page+layouts+and+columns+and+sections?focusedCommentId=282988609#comment-282988609
{quote}
Anonymous

Unfortunately page layouts are not rendered in pdf. They are removed completely, so the content just goes on as it was in the next paragraph. (sad)

Will there be any solution to that?
{quote}

I have tried the PDF export of a single page (on EAC, running Confluence 4.3-CDOG-1700) and had a similar result. I have not tried the space PDF export.
fields.summary: PDF export does not handle page layouts

fields.description:
The new editor only has Cancel button on the bottom/right. Previously there was extra set of buttons on the top/right to save a lot of mouse movement.

That's weird I can not reopen CONF-25182 which was answered only partially (about the Save button). So I am forced to open another bug...
fields.summary: Confluence 4 editor does NOT have Cancel button on the top of the page
Make threads with notification mails in Thunderbird

fields.description:
h4. Symptom
WYSIWYG Editor: In IE8 it is impossible to merge all table cells of the last row of a table.

h4. Workaround
Add an additional row at the bottom of the table so that you can merge the specific cells before removing the additional row.
fields.summary: Impossible to merge table cells of the last row of a table (IE8)

fields.description:
h2.Steps to reproduce:
# Go to _Browse > Labels_
# It will take a long to load, and even timeout.

Also general slowness and crashing due to long running SQL queries can be a symptom of this problem.

h4. Workaround
Our developers have created a patch that can be applied to all versions of Confluence 4.2, up to and including 4.2.4. The issue will be resolved permanently in 4.2.5.

h5. How to apply the patch
# Copy the Label.hbm.xml file attached to this ticket, to *<confluence-install>/confluence/WEB-INF/classes/com/atlassian/confluence/labels/*. Create the folders if they do not exist.
# Once this is done, restart your Confluence instance.

h5. Limitations
Because of the nature of the patch, once it is applied, labels on attachments will not show up in popular labels, suggested labels and recently updated labels. This will be resolved in 4.2.5 when the permanent fix is released.

h5. Future-proofing
Once you upgrade to 4.2.5, this patch must be removed. It may cause issues down the track if it is not.
fields.summary: Slow response and Confluence crashing when you have too many labels

fields.description:
I've tested this a bit and the layout is OK (ie, labels and button in the same row) in Chrome 18.0.1025 and wrong in Firefox 6 on Linux, Firefox 11 on Windows or IE8 on Windows, where the labels and the button all are laid out in different rows, making the table very long.

On the other hand, the listing produced by the Tools / Attachments menu is correct.

For us this is a showstopper, won't be deploying 4.2 in production without a fix.
fields.summary: "attachments" macro has wrong layout in all Firefox (11 and down) and IE. Labels shown in rows

fields.description: Attempt to view storage format on a page that has not content.

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Type 'mvn exec:java'
Interim result: all plain text
2. Select just typed text, hit Ctrl+C (or Ctrl+X), then Ctrl+V
Result: "exec:java" became a link
Expected result: text pasted exactly as it was copied.

(just deleted a long runt here about this function being called *copy* for the reason - it is increasingly tough to stay polite reporting countless bugs in the new Editor)
fields.summary: Text with colon incorrectly reconglised as a link

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce
1. Type '# some text'
2. Hit enter two times (to get out of numbered list)
3. Type 'some more text'
4. using keyboard navigate to the end of the numbered line (after the "some text" entered
5. type 'and more text'
6. hit DELETE
Expected result: next line with "some more text" comes up to form the one numbered line with all the text entered
Actual result: nothing happens
Workaround: sometimes navigating out of the line with the mouse, then back in and hitting END helps - DELETE works after that. Sometimes getting to the next line and using BACKSPACE helps.

Bugs like this are terribly annoying. There are lots of them - editor is not doing what it is asked to do. It is just not that easy to come up with reliable steps to reproduce for all of its weird quirks.
fields.summary: DEL at the end of the numbered line doesn't delete the line break

fields.description: In the new editor Shift-Del works like just "DEL" - not storying the infrormation into the clipboard.
fields.summary: Shift-Del doesn't work on Linux

fields.description:
When a page contains a link that refers to the page itself, then the link cannot be editor with the "Edit Link" dialogue.

*Steps to reproduce:*

# Create a new empty page.
# Save the page
# Edit the page
# Insert a link that refers to the current page. Now the link can be edited with the context menu.
# Save the page.
# Edit the page and click the link that was created before.
# Select "Edit" in the context menu

Result: The "Edit Link" dialog does not appear as expected. (Tested with Google Chrome 18 and Firefox 11.)
fields.summary: Cannot edit a link that refers to the current page

fields.description: When a image or table has been inserted into a confluence page that is longer than the screen hieght, clicking on white space next to the image jumps the cursor to the top of the page.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*
# Configure Application Link between JIRA 5.0.1 and Confluence 3.5.1

# JIRA Project Activity Stream at Project Summary page will show the updates from all the spaces in Confluence even though only one space is configured in JIRA Project Application Link

Update info on one page automatically showing up on another page

fields.description: When using the jiraissues macro with the parameter count = true, and there is only one issue, the macro returns "1 issues".  It should return  "1 issue".  I am using this macro as part of a release note document where I would like to display the number of issues after some text like:  "New issues created this week (1 issue)".  However the text looks like: "New issues created this week (1 issues)".  Ideally I would like to just have the number as in:  "New issues created this week (1)".
fields.summary: {jiraissues:count=true}  states "1 issues" if there is one issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-25217].
  {panel}

Scope: 
- adding a Google Apps drawing to a confluence page
-- selecting the drawing by using a widget (would prefer a balsamiq-like integration though)

Problem: 
I can not add a Google Docs *drawing* to a confluence page as I could add a Google Docs *Document*. 
- When using a widget that uses the Google Documents Picker the drawing does not show up and can not be added. 
- When using the Widget connector the confluence page will only show a blank white area, not matter if I published to Web by making the drawing public or by requiring Google Apps credentials for viewing it.

Goal: 
- I want to have a scoping session with my development team pointing them to the design page on Confluence. If necessary anyone in the team should be able to click on the document, bringing it into edit mode and we could redraw live as necessary.

Workaround: 
- Create the Google Drawing
- Export it as PNG
- Attach the PNG to the Confluence page
- Copy the Google Docs link
- Add the Google Docs link to the Confluence page
- Do the review session
- Modify the Google Drawing
- Export it as PNG
- Attach the new PNG to the Confluence page

Suggested Solutions:

The ideal integration would just embed the Google Drawing into the Confluence page and anyone who wants to edit it could click on an "Edit"-link. 
Clicking on "Edit" would load the drawing into Google Docs.

The good-enough-solution would be to support drawings in the Widget Connector 
not requiring the publishing step in Google Docs, but just using the Google Docs link that has /edit at the end 

The goal must be to allow us to collaborate on the drawing, not requiring a manual update of links or attachments. The envisioned interaction is like the Balsamiq plug-in in a Google-Docs-Link-multi-user mode.
fields.summary: As a product owner using Google Apps I want to add a google drawing to a confluence page so that I can share diagrams with engineers
Allow macro parameters to be editable by KB shortcuts
KB shortcut for deleting tables

fields.description:
Whilst a whole-page drop zone may be seen as a useful feature by some (and a major annoyance by others), it is not appropriate when the page is not being edited.

The expected behaviour for dropping a file onto a browser window is to open that file, unless there is a specifically designated drop zone. If that is the edit area of a wiki, then it is plausible for this to upload the file.

Nonetheless, while in display mode, there should be no option for unchecked or implicit uploading of attachments. In particular, users should not be able to attach files if they can't edit the page (particularly if they can't remove those attachments).

Recommended fix is to remove the drop zone altogether when in Display mode.
An option is to ask for verification in the modal lightbox before uploading the file.
fields.summary: There should be no drop zone for attachments while in Display mode (especially the whole page!)

fields.description:
Two customers have reported that the new recommended updates email in Confluence 4.2 goes to ALL LDAP users whether logged in or not.

See comments on this documentation page: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+the+Recommended+Updates+Email+Notification

Please investigate.
fields.summary: Customers report that the recommended updates email goes to ALL LDAP users whether logged in or not

fields.description:
As shown in  TEAMCAL-535 the Confluence Clustered Cache contains a bug in the way plugins are stored.
Each time the Team Calendar plugin changes the entire cluster needs to be rebooted.
fields.summary: Plugin installation breaks clustered cache

fields.description:
In Confluence 5.6.x, member of "confluence-administrators" group can click "Edit" button and start editing the page. They receive a "Not Permitted" page when "Save" button is clicked.

If the "Close" button is clicked instead (to exit the editor without saving), a blank page will be returned instead.

{panel}
*Steps to replicate*
# Make User B as the member of {{confluence-administrators}} group
# User A creates a page and applies a restriction to a specific group
# User B is Not a member of that group but Is a Space Administrator for the space
# User B goes to the page and the edit function is enabled
# User B Clicks Edit and starts to make changes
# User B finishes making changes to the page and clicks Save (which is enabled)
# User B gets the message "You are not permitted to perform this operation"
{panel}

{panel}
*Other Steps to replicate*
# Make User A as the member of {{confluence-administrators}} group
# User A creates a space and makes User B the only Space Administrator
# User A goes to the page and the edit function is enabled
# User A Clicks Edit and starts to make changes
# User A finishes making changes to the page and clicks Save (which is enabled)
# User A gets the message "You are not permitted to perform this operation"
# User A gets blank page below main Confluence top navigation bar when clicking Close after entering editor.
{panel}

*Workarounds*

There are a few workarounds to this, and reasons why we don't see this bug as critical:

# Most importantly, Atlassian recommends not using your administration account for regular use of Confluence. Create separate admin and user accounts instead.
# Use your admin powers to grant yourself permission to edit the page (at space and page level as required), then edit the page again.
# Use the back button to get back to your changes and copy/paste them for saving as a user that is explicitly permitted to edit the page. (If the back button doesn't work in your scenario, please raise a ticket with steps to reproduce - we'd like to fix this.)
# Until CONF-4616 is fixed, grant administrators "System Administration" permission but do not put them in the "confluence-administrators" group if you do not wish them to have access to all content in your system. (This is in relation to the original bug.)
fields.summary: "Not Permitted" page when members of confluence-administrators attempt to edit pages on which they do not have edit permission

fields.description:
We have Confluence setup behind an Apache reverse proxy and our Server Base URL is set to "*https*://confluence...". However, when Confluence sends out a 301, it always sends the Location: *http*://confluence..., which then gets redirected by Apache to *https*://confluence...

Confluence should respect the Server Base URL setting and use the proper URL when redirecting.

I'm attaching a series of 8 images showing how cumbersome this can get when logging in and then getting redirected many times when trying to visit the homepage. (best viewed in order from 0->7)

I'm also attaching two relevant Apache Config files.

- The first redirects all non-SSL requests to be SSL requests
- The second actually handles the proxying to localhost over SSL
fields.summary: Confluence does not respect HTTPS in Server Base URL when 301 redirecting

fields.description:
h3.Problem

When embedding the content of another page using the [include macro|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Include+Page+Macro] the images from the source page are not exported when [exporting the page to HTML|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Exporting+Confluence+Pages+and+Spaces+to+HTML].

See this [screnn shot|^Include_Page.png], also check the sample [ZIP file|^ds-183324-6.html.zip].

This issue seem related to this old bug CONF-5143, possibly they are related to the same cause or is a recurrence of the same bug.

h3.Fix

There is none yet.

h3.Workaround
Export to HTML from the source page.
fields.summary: Html Export doens't include images when using Include page macro

fields.description:
The {{demo-space.zip}} included with Confluence 4.2 can't be imported through normal restore method.

Steps to replicate:
# Make sure the Demonstration Space does not exists on your Confluence. 
# Go to Browse > Confluence Admin > Backup & Restore
# Restore the bundled {{demo-site.zip}} which is located on the {{<CONFLUENCE_INSTALL>\confluence\WEB-INF\classes\com\atlassian\confluence\setup}}
# This will return the following error

!restoreError.png!

h4. Workaround
Use the attached zip file to restore the bundled Demonstration Space.
* https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/62846/demo-site-2.zip
fields.summary: Demonstration Space delivered with Confluence 4.2 cannot be imported into a Confluence 4.2 installation

fields.description:
h3.Steps to Reproduce
# Copy the following:
{code}
if [ -z "$CATALINA_PID" ] ; then
    if [ -n "$CATALINA_BASE" ] ; then
        CATALINA_PID="$CATALINA_BASE"/work/catalina.pid
    elif [ -n "$CATALINA_HOME" ] ; then
        CATALINA_PID="$CATALINA_HOME"/work/catalina.pid
    fi
fi
{code}
# Create a new page in Confluence
# Add a *Noformat* macro into the page
# Paste the code above into the Noformat Macro (Notice that leading whitespaces are stripped)

This is only reproducible in IE8. IE9, Chrome, Firefox works fine. 

Tested on http://confluence.atlassian.com as well (4.2rc1)
fields.summary: Noformat Macro strips off leading whitespaces in IE8
Create blog post as different user

fields.description: Today we have faced a 100% CPU Load for several hours which has only been fixed by restarting Confluence. As this has caused a major performance issue for us I am interested what the root cause was and how we can prevent this in future.
fields.summary: 100% CPU Usage for several hours

fields.description:
Live numbering using Numbered Headings does not work with IE8, due to the existence of this markup: 
{code}
<meta http-equiv="X-UA-Compatible" content="IE=7"/>
{code}

See [NUMHEAD-62|https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/browse/NUMHEAD-62?focusedCommentId=57780&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-57780]

h3.Steps to Reproduce:
# Install the Numbered Headings plugin with his [JAR|https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/20520/numberedheadings-2.0.4-SNAPSHOT.jar]
# Create a New Page
# Add the Numbered Headings Macro into the page
# Insert any Headings into the Macro. Notice that live numbering does not appear in the Macro. Same behavior is not observed in any other browsers except IE8

h3.Expected Behavior:
http://screencast.com/t/ckFIgTLk

h3.Observed Behavior on IE8:
http://screencast.com/t/rYvwNrrL

Please see Tomas comment https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-25203?focusedCommentId=306321&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-306321 regarding this. It seems it is not only a problem with the Numbered Heading plugin, but rather a problem with the Editor.
fields.summary: Meta element forces the Editor in IE into using the IE 7 rendering engine, which breaks some plugins

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a new page choosing a page layout that has a footer section
2. Insert the Popular Labels Macro into the footer section of the page layout, choosing to display as a heatmap
3. Save and view the page

The varying font sizes that should be evident in the heatmap have been overridden by OnDemand footer CSS and also [this workaround|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFDEV-7754].
fields.summary: Font sizes in the Popular Labels Macro Heatmap are being overridden when placed in the footer section of a page layout
When rendering pages, check for invalid XML characters before attempting to parse the content

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-25198]. {panel} The encoding test that we provide to admin users at {{/admin/encodingtest.action}} could be improved to also test unicode values outside the \u00x range. This may help to identify situations where the character coding within Confluence (UTF-8) doesn't match the database encoding. A specific example is that one of our customers had their Oracle database encoding set to US7ASCII. When unicode values outside of the \u00x range were inserted into a page, they get their top byte dropped and their lower byte value is stored as a single byte. When this page is viewed (after any cached input is flushed), it displays the following error: {code}Error: The XML content could not be parsed. There is a problem at line 1, column 613. Parser message: Illegal character ((CTRL-CHAR, code 25)) at [row,col {unknown-source}]: [1,613]{code} Further details about this particular example (provided by the customer) are as follows: {code} Input String: \u0061 \u2019 \u0062 \u3019 \u0063 Dump of Stored page: ------------------------------------------------------------ contentid :63864839 Length ascii:18 utf8:18 ------------------------------------------------------------ 0: Found invalid XML char: '?' (25) \u0019 at index: 12 ------------------------------------------------------------ hexDump 000000: \u003c \u0070 \u003e \u0061 \u0026 \u0072 \u0073 \u0071 \u0075 \u006f \u003b \u0062 \u0019 \u0063 \u003c \u002f 000016: \u0070 \u003e 144 bits ------------------------------------------------------------

a’b?c

------------------------------------------------------------ \u003c \u0070 \u003e <---- "

" \u0061 <---- 'a' \u0026 \u0072 \u0073 \u0071 \u0075 \u006f \u003b <---- "’" \u0062 <---- 'b' \u0019 <---- strips top byte stores lower 0x19 byte \u0063 <---- 'c' \u003c \u002f \u0070 \u003e <---- "

" {code}
fields.summary: /admin/encodingtest.action should test unicode values outside the \u00xx range
Exporting space to XML without page-level restrictions

2. Type a comment in the comment box and press CMd+s. the comment changes to "saving" state

fields.description:
It is not possible to deselect "Subscribe to recommended updates" in the user profile.

To reproduce the problem, go to the "Settings" tab in your user profile and choose "Email". Edit the email settings, and remove the tick in the check box for "Subscribe to recommended updates". Save your changes. The tick re-appears in the check box.

I have tried this on CAC (Confluence 4.2-rc1) and EAC (Confluence 4.3-CDOG-1700).

A customer has also reported the problem in a comment on a doc page:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+the+Recommended+Updates+Email+Notification?focusedCommentId=282174872#comment-282174872

{quote}
Brad Beaver

Having a little trouble here.  I've attempted to disable "Subscribe to recommended updates" under my Profile settings but after making the change and hitting Submit the change does not take affect.  I cannot disable this for myself (or any other user).
{quote}
fields.summary: It is not possible to deselect "Subscribe to recommended updates" in the user profile

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-25190].
  {panel}

The "3. Editor Find & Replace" feature added to [Confluence 4.1|http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=269981290] could really use the addition of (optional) support for regular expressions in the "find" term, and back-references in the "replace" term.

Similar support is available in JSPWiki, and allows complex search/replace to be done on pages.

Example:

Make all bullet list entries bold:

Find (regex): ^(\* )(.+)
Replace:      \1*\2*

(assumes backreferences to capturing groups are made using backslash, JSPWiki uses "$")

A screenshot using the above example, using JSPWiki, is attached to this issue
fields.summary: Add Regular Expression support to editor search & replace

fields.description:
Editing a numbered list that existed in 3.5.x and was upgraded to 4.1.2; unable to insert a line of un-numbered text (a description) between numbered items because the editor inserts a CRLF and auto-numbering starts over at "1". 

This is a significant issue when I document tasks. Often, a numbered step requires a comment or description.

This is what I expect:
1. Click Foo.
The Foo dialog box opens.
2. In the Foo dialog box, select one of the following:
Foo Me
Foo You
Foo Them
Foo Us All


This is what the editor produces:
1. Click Foo.
The Foo dialog box opens.
2. In the Foo dialog box, select one of the following:
3. Foo Me
4. Foo You
5. Foo Them
6. Foo Us All


This is the undesireable workaround:
1. Click Foo.
The Foo dialog box opens.
2. In the Foo dialog box, select one of the following: Foo Me, Foo You, Foo Them, Foo Us All
fields.summary: Numbered Lists - Can't insert an un-numbered line of text between number

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-25173].
  {panel}

Hi,

There is our customer's report. 
Non-ascii characters that are contained in a comment added in page are broken.
(Please see the attached screenshot.)

The validated result by each web clients:
|| OS || Browser || Result ||
| Windows 7 | IE9 | (x) |
| Windows 7 | Chrome | (x) |
| Windows 7 | Firefox | (/) |
| Mac OS X | Safari | (x) |

This problem's impact is very critical. Please fix it immediately.

Best regards,
Kan Ogawa
Ricksoft support
fields.summary: Non ascii comment content is corrupted when using the new Quick Comment mechanism (except for Firefox users)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-25171].
  {panel}

com.atlassian.confluence.plugins:confluence-like

The com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.like.DefaultLikeSummaryCreator composes sentences for the like summary, afaics these are seven possible sentences (see related issues).

The problem is that the composition approach works for English, and kind of works for German, but we're already in trouble for French. E.g. likes.summary.word.like, which is used for "Vous aimez ça" (You like this) and "2 personnes aimez ça" (2 people like this, but should really be "2 personnes aiment ça"). I'm sure there will be more problems arising when it comes to e.g. the Asian languages.

The correct implementation should be to have distinctive i18n keys for all possible sentences. Redundancy in i18n is a good thing ...
fields.summary: Change DefaultLikeSummaryCreator implementation to use distinctive i18n keys
Fix French translation for the comment summary in "Confluence Like Plugin"

fields.description:
TEST CASE:
1. Create a wiki page with some text.
2. Save the page.
3. Edit that page again. Check is the text displayed as it was entered before.

EXPECTED BEHAVIOUR:
Should be the same

OBSERVED BEHAVIOUR:
Empty rows appeared between the rows with the text (screenshot). After saving everything looks normally, in preview mode looks normally as well.
fields.summary: Empty rows appear between the text lines of the page in Edit mode

fields.description:
TEST CASE:

1. Create a wiki page with the list: ordered and unordered.
2. Change the color of the font to any, that is different from the default black.
3. Check, if the list changed its color completely.

EXPECTED BEHAVIOUR:
The numerals (in ordered list) or other elements (in unordered list) should change color as well.

OBSERVED BEHAVIOUR:
The numerals and other elements don't change its color, remaining default black (screenshot).
fields.summary: The beginning of the list remains of default color even when the font is colored.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-25159].
  {panel}

Currently when using the search field in the top right corner of each Confluence page the user reaches a search page. This pages shows, on the right hand side, a grey box offering several search filters: "Where", "What", "When" and "Who".

These search filters are distracting for our users, because most of the options offered make no sense in our configuration. More precisely:

"Where" - The normal users access the wiki without login and the wiki is configured to consist of only *one* public space - so there is nothing to choose for these users. Things like "personal spaces" and "global spaces" only irritate average users, since they don't know (and need not know) what those mean.

"What" - Out users expect that a search searches on the wiki. Period.
- News-Entries - we don't have any news enabled.
- Comments - We don't use them either (our wiki is a documentation, not a discussion forum)
- Profile, Email - Users don't care about this either

"When" and "Where" - Those public users (not logged in) simply don't care who wrote the documentation when, neither should they care!


There are two improvements i'd like to suggest:
1. Make the "Where" and "What" filters more intelligent to only show options that make sense given the user group's permissions and the wiki's enabled/disabled features.

and/or (my preferred solution)
2. Make it configurable which search filters are available to which user groups. Our customers have asked us whether we can hide the grey filter box completely for public users, and I can understand perfectly well that these filters indeed don't help them. For admins, however, they can be useful.

Matthias Basler
fields.summary: Make search filteres more aware of user's permissions, hide unnecessary options

fields.description:
Current state (4.2), keys are only used in com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.like.DefaultLikeSummaryCreator:

likes.summary.word.you + likes.summary.word.like + likes.summary.word.this + "."
	"You like this."
	"Du Gefällt mir dies."

"<uref>" + likes.summary.word.likes + likes.summary.word.this + "." 
	"<uref> likes this."
	"<uref> Gefällt mir dies."

"<ucount>" + likes.summary.word.like + likes.summary.word.this + "."
	"<ucount> people like this."
	"<ucount> Personen Gefällt mir dies."

likes.summary.word.you + likes.summary.word.and + "<uref>" + likes.summary + "."
	"You and <uref> like this."
	"Du und <uref> Gefällt mir dies."

likes.summary.word.you + likes.summary.word.and + "<ucount>" + likes.summary.word.others + likes.summary.word.like + likes.summary.word.this + "."
	"You and <ucount> others like this."
	"Du und <ucount> andere Gefällt mir dies."

likes.summary.word.you + ", <uref> " + likes.summary.word.and + " <uref2> " + likes.summary.word.like + likes.summary.word.this + "."
	"You, <uref> and <uref2> like this."
	"Du, <uref> und <uref2> Gefällt mir dies."

likes.summary.word.you + ", <uref> " + likes.summary.word.and + " <uref2> " + likes.summary.word.and + " <ucount> " + likes.summary.word.others + likes.summary.word.like + likes.summary.word.this + "."
	"You, <uref>, <uref2> and <ucount> others like this."
	"Du, <uref>, <uref2> und <ucount> andere Gefällt mir dies."
fields.summary: Fix German translation for the comment summary in "Confluence Like Plugin"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-25151].
  {panel}

https://maven.atlassian.com/public/com/atlassian/confluence/testing/jmeter/performance-testing/

Could you please release the same for later versions of Confluence including 4.1.x and 4.2?

Thank you for your assistance.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-25150].
  {panel}

Currently, if multiple user directories are defined in Confluence, the Add/Remove User operations will only be applied to the top directory. If the top directory cannot be modified via Confluence (e.g. LDAP read-only directory), the operation will fail.

In order to add a user to the Confluence Internal Directory in this configuration, one would need to swap the directory order in Confluence Admin > User Directories, add the user, then swap it back. This procedure is inconvenient and oftentimes confusing.

Instead, Confluence should automatically add the user to the Internal Directory if no other directory can be modified, and give a choice to the user if there are multiple possible directories (e.g. 'Confluence Internal Directory' and 'Internal with LDAP Authentication').

This behavior would also be more consistent with the user management behavior in JIRA.
fields.summary: Ability to add/remove user in a specified user directory

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-25146].
  {panel}

Hi All,

let me ask for a help: is there a wikimarkup or macro we can automatically sort the headings in a pge in Confluence? There is a page in our company where are important infos about applications are listed (more than 100). The content is continuinely gaining with new application infos.
A heading= name of the application

But to find the correct place of an application name is very cumbersome. So it would be very helpful if we could add the new content to the end of the page and after save the new content jumps to its correct place in the alphabetically order.

Tanks for your suggestions!

 

Best Regards,

Rumi
fields.summary: Sort headings automatically in a page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-25145].
  {panel}

In the Confluence 4.x editor, when the newline preceding a heading is deleted, the heading is reformatted to plain text. For example, when I have this text in the editor (as if it were entered using wikitext):

{noformat}
h1. First heading
Some text
h2. Second heading
More text
{noformat}

When I do this:

- Place cursor at the beginning of the word "Some"
- Hold shift and press down-arrow
- Press delete

I expect to end up with this:

{noformat}
h1. First heading
h2. Second heading
More text
{noformat}

But instead I end up with this:

{noformat}
h1. First heading
Second heading
More text
{noformat}

My heading formatting is lost. This is inconsistent with at least two other scenarios: (1) Deleting a newline preceding a bulleted list, and (2) Deleting a newline preceding a block of preformatted text, both of which retain the formatting of the text that follows the newline, which I think is correct/expected behavior.

Here is a [more detailed description of the issue|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+4.0+Editor+-+Customer+Feedback?focusedCommentId=277252891#comment-277252891].
fields.summary: Heading loses formatting when preceding newline is deleted
Expand Macro Not Working in Dashboard

fields.description: when Create a page with the Attachments Macro and click in the "Remove link" of the Attachments Macro - this will clear the list of attachments entirely, it does not refresh properly in Chrome.
fields.summary: Attachments plugin Remove link does not properly refresh page in Chrome

fields.description:
Whether it is the full page editor, or the comment editor (or the quick comment editor). OnDemand in Chrome and IE9 has this problem. I haven't tested Firefox.

Standalone Confluence (e.g. confxhtml) does not have the problem.
fields.summary: The shortcut 'e' does not switch the editor back from preview to edit in OnDemand.
